summary: The PFAS-Free Procurement Act of 2025 prohibits executive agencies from renewing or entering contracts for the procurement of items containing perfluorooctane sulfonate (PFOS) or perfluorooctanoic acid (PFOA). It mandates prioritizing the procurement of covered items (nonstick cookware, cooking utensils, furniture, carpet, and rugs treated with stain-resistant coating) that do not contain PFAS (perfluoroalkyl or polyfluoroalkyl substances). The law goes into effect six months after its enactment and aims to reduce exposure to harmful chemicals.
